intro: Clidemia rhamnifolia var. macrodon, commonly known as the broad-leaved mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white, powdery bloom. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on the branches of trees in tropical forests. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly impact the health of its host plants.
